Mubarak resigned as head of the ruling NDP.<Ref>http://www.thejournal.ie/mubarak-focuses-on-economic-issues-as-protests-continue-2011-02/</ref><ref>http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/Egypt-ruling-party-executive-committee-resigns-TV/articleshow/7433218.cms</ref> State television announced the appointment of [[Hossam Badrawi]] as Head of the Shura Council after [[Safwat El-Sherif]]'s resignation from his position within the party. Mubarak's son [[Gamal Mubarak|Gamal]] also resigned as Assistant Secretary and Secretary of the Policy Committee.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/02/05/136363.html |title=Ø¥ÙØµØ§Ø¡ Ø¬ÙØ§Ù ÙØ§ÙØ´Ø±ÙÙ ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙÙØ·ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØµØ±Ù.. ÙØªØ¹ÙÙÙ Ø¨Ø¯Ø±Ø§ÙÙ Ø£ÙÙÙØ§ |publisher=Alarabiya.net |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> Minister of State for Legal Affairs Mufid Shehab and Presidential Chief-of-Staff Zakaria Azmy were also dismissed from the party.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/ndp-overhaul-meager-concession-says-opposition |title=NDP overhaul a meager concession, says opposition | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> However, the opposition leaders continued to seek ways to remove Mubarak from power. They called on the protesters to continue at Tahrir Square every Tuesday and Friday until Mubarak "resigns and makes true the demands of the people."<ref name="CNN 5 Feb"/>
Mubarak resigned as head of the ruling NDP.<Ref>http://www.thejournal.ie/mubarak-focuses-on-economic-issues-as-protests-continue-2011-02/</ref><ref>http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/middle-east/Egypt-ruling-party-executive-committee-resigns-TV/articleshow/7433218.cms</ref> State television announced the appointment of [[Hossam Badrawi]] as Head of the Shura Council after [[Safwat El-Sherif]]'s resignation from his position within the party. Mubarak's son [[Gamal Mubarak|Gamal]] also resigned as Assistant Secretary and Secretary of the Policy Committee.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/02/05/136363.html |title=Ø¥ÙØµØ§Ø¡ Ø¬ÙØ§Ù ÙØ§ÙØ´Ø±ÙÙ ÙÙ Ø§ÙØ­Ø²Ø¨ Ø§ÙÙØ·ÙÙ Ø§ÙÙØµØ±Ù.. ÙØªØ¹ÙÙÙ Ø¨Ø¯Ø±Ø§ÙÙ Ø£ÙÙÙØ§ |publisher=Alarabiya.net |date= |accessdate=2011-02-05}}</ref> Minister of State for Legal Affairs Mufid Shehab and Presidential Chief-of-Staff Zakaria Azmy were also dismissed from the party.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.almasryalyoum.com/en/news/ndp-overhaul-meager-concession-says-opposition |title=NDP overhaul a meager concession, says opposition | Al-Masry Al-Youm: Today's News from Egypt |publisher=Al-Masry Al-Youm |date= |accessdate=2011-02-06}}</ref> However, the opposition leaders continued to seek ways to remove Mubarak from power. They called on the protesters to continue at Tahrir Square every Tuesday and Friday until Mubarak "resigns and makes true the demands of the people."<ref name="CNN 5 Feb"/>

====6 February- Day of martyrs====
+
====6 February â Day of martyrs====
During the night of 5-6 February, some protesters continued to camp out in Tahrir Square, while Alexandria also had peaceful late night protests. However, gunfire rang out in the early hours of the day in Cairo.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
During the night of 5-6 February, some protesters continued to camp out in Tahrir Square, while Alexandria also had peaceful late night protests. However, gunfire rang out in the early hours of the day in Cairo.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
